business.headline: New Income Tax rules from April 2026: What will change for taxpayersIndia is set to usher in a new Income Tax law from April 1, 2026. The new Income Tax Act aims to simplify tax rules, improve clarity and make compliance easier for taxpayers in an increasingly digital system.

Promoter families seek Sebi nod on daughters-in-law under takeover rules: ReportOver the past decade, an increasing number of business families have moved promoter holdings, or portions of them, into private family trusts, with family members as beneficiaries.

Why France's generous pension system is becoming an economic burdenWhat was once seen as a pillar of social security is now becoming a growing strain on public finances, as demographic and economic pressures mount.

Thinking of moving abroad? These places charge zero income taxAcross the world, around 19 countries do not charge personal income tax. They are spread across the Middle East, the Caribbean, parts of Europe, and the Pacific.

Vedanta's Anil Agarwal will give away 75% wealth to fulfil dead son's wishWith his son's death, Anil Agarwal says his commitment to give away over 75% of earnings stands firm, signalling a deeper shift toward philanthropy, simpler living, and long-term social investment beyond business success.

Sensex, Nifty open flat as markets ignore fresh US tariff threat; TCS down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 116.63 points to 84,844.51, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 33.70 points to 26,107.05 as of 9:22 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will market open lower after 500% tariff threat from US?Markets have been under pressure for several sessions. The Nifty 50 has slipped 0.7% over the last three trading days, while the BSE Sensex has declined 0.9% during the same period.

Trump bars defence company payouts until weapons production speeds upTrump and senior Pentagon officials have repeatedly criticised major defence companies for failing to deliver weapons and systems at the pace demanded by modern conflicts. They have argued that lengthy delays and ballooning budgets weaken US military readiness and undermine taxpayer confidence.

Darkest day of my life: Vedanta's Anil Agarwal's son dies of cardiac arrest at 49Agarwal's post referenced a longstanding pledge made between father and son to support several social priorities, such as food access, education for children, empowering women, and secure employment for young Indians. Agarwal renewed the promise to devote over 75% of group earnings to initiatives that benefit society.

Union Budget to be presented on Sunday, Feb 1; Economic Survey on Jan 29This will be only the second time the Union Budget will be presented on a Sunday. In 1999, the Budget was presented on a Sunday for the first time.

Silver jumps Rs 5000 to hit record high of Rs 2.56 lakh per kg in Delhi marketsSilver prices jumped by Rs 5,000 to a fresh all-time high of Rs 2.56 lakh per kilogram in the Delhi market, driven by strong safe-haven demand, robust industrial buying and supply concerns.

Budget 2026: Why insurance and policy reforms are in focusAs Budget 2026 approaches, the insurance industry is pushing for structural tax reforms, enhanced retirement security, and measures to improve access to inclusive insurance products, focusing on how policy direction will impact premium financing and sector growth.

Netflix offering better value: Warner Bros rejects Paramount's revised hostile bidParamount launched a hostile takeover bid worth USD 108.4 billion for Warner Bros. Discovery on December 8, disrupting Warner Bros' preliminary merger talks with Netflix.

Budget 2026: Last year's income tax changes and what may be in focus this timeBudget 2025 delivered meaningful relief to a large section of salaried taxpayers, sharply narrowed the gap between the old and new tax regimes, and set the direction for how personal taxation would evolve going forward.

India's GDP growth expected at 7.4% in FY26Government measures played an important role in supporting growth. Income tax relief and steps to rationalise GST rates helped shore up consumer demand, even as global conditions remained uncertain.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as auto, energy stocks drag despite IT gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 102.20 points to close at 84,961.14, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 37.95 points to end at 26,140.75.

Airfare spike under scanner as government seeks data from major airlines: ReportIndia's Directorate General of Civil Aviation, which oversees safety, has written to airlines asking for average fares on each route they operated on, for economy and premium economy seats, over the period December 1-15, according to a report.

Employer not paying salary or incentives? Here's what you can doCases of delayed salaries, unpaid incentives and withheld bonuses have become more frequent, especially in young companies and firms facing cash stress. Legal experts say salary and incentives are not favours.

How Sebi's 15% rule sets a ceiling on broker growth, explains Zerodha's Nithin KamathNithin Kamath said Sebi has fixed a 15% open interest limit for brokers in the derivatives market. This means no single broker is allowed to hold more than 15% of the total market open interest at any given time.

The hidden cost quietly eating up to 25% of your mutual fund returnsA study by 1 Finance Research shows that over a 10-year holding period, more than 80% of equity mutual fund schemes leave investors in regular plans at least 25% worse off than those invested in the direct plan of the same scheme.

entertainment.headline: Shatrughan Sinha wishes ex Reena Roy on 69th birthday, calls her a dear friend Veteran actor Shatrughan Sinha wished Reena Roy on her 69th birthday with nostalgic throwbacks. Their celebrated on-screen pairing is fondly remembered despite their separate personal paths.

Ikkis box office Day 7: Agastya Nanda's war drama faces struggle but stays steady Sriram Raghavan's period war drama 'Ikkis', featuring Agastya Nanda, Jaideep Ahlawat, and Dharmendra, closed its first week at the Indian box office with Rs 24.25 crore, despite facing competition from 'Dhurandhar'.

Vijay's Jana Nayagan postponed: Ravi Mohan and celebs rally in support Actors and filmmakers from the Tamil film industry have voiced support for Vijay and the Jana Nayagan team after the film's release was postponed due to a delay in censor certification.

Bradley Cooper shuts down crazy plastic surgery rumours Actor Bradley Cooper has directly responded to ongoing plastic surgery rumours during a recent SmartLess podcast episode, firmly denying the claims as he continues promoting his latest directorial film.

Kriti Sanon flies to Udaipur with family, Kabir Bahia for sister's wedding. Watch Nupur Sanon and musician Stebin Ben are set to marry on January 11, in a multi-day celebration in Udaipur with family and close friends.

Sonu Sood urges vaccination, sterilisation for stray dogs: Choose kindness Sonu Sood has come out in support of India's stray dogs, backing vaccination and sterilisation as humane solutions to control rabies and the growing stray population.

Film body seeks PM's help to release Dhurandhar in Gulf countries Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar is banned across six Gulf countries. Indian Motion Picture Producers' Association has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to intervene for the film's release in the region.

Ahead of BTS' 2026 comeback, here's how Jungkook stays fit Jung Kook of BTS has revealed a shift in his daily habits, including a new diet and focus on health, as he prepares for both the group's upcoming album and his own solo ambitions.

Jana Nayagan postponed: Nearly Rs 50 crore loss, refunds initiated for Vijay film Vijay's Jana Nayagan was postponed two days before release due to a censor certificate delay. This last-minute change has led to significant financial losses and disrupted international screen allocations.

Revisiting Bimal Roy's Parakh: A political satire rooted in human frailty January 8, 2026, marks Bimal Roy's 60th death anniversary. We revisit his craft, discussing one of his most unusual films – the 1960 satire, Parakh. Through the film, Roy restored faith in humanism and used  the power of satire to reveal frailty without judgment.

Aamir Khan reacts to brother Faissal cutting ties with family, calls it destiny Aamir Khan and his family have responded to Faissal Khan's statements regarding family decisions and personal matters, urging for privacy and sensitivity from the public and media.

Priyanka Chopra shares late-night family fun with viral Whitney Houston challenge Priyanka Chopra shared a fun family moment with Nick Jonas and daughter Malti, which won hearts on social media. Meanwhile, she is preparing for her upcoming Hollywood film The Bluff, where she plays a fierce pirate.

Emraan Hashmi recalls being stopped at immigration: I fit the bill Actor Emraan Hashmi recounted personal experiences with airport immigration checks at the trailer launch of his upcoming web series Taskaree: The Smuggler's Web, reflecting on profiling and the changing nature of security scrutiny over the years.

Toxic teaser: Yash as Raya unleashes a fierce world of violence and destruction The teaser for Yash's 'Toxic – A Fairytale for Grown-Ups' is out, sparking huge excitement among fans. Promising an edgy, stylish world supported by a strong ensemble and international crew, the film is slated for a big March 19 release.

Bigg Boss 15's Raqesh Bapat to participate in Bigg Boss 6 Marathi: Report Raqesh Bapat, noted for his appearances in Bigg Boss OTT and Bigg Boss 15, is expected to return to reality television by joining the contestant lineup for Bigg Boss Marathi 6. The season, hosted by Riteish Deshmukh, will also see several other prominent personalities entering the house.

Dhurandhar box office Day 34: Ranveer's film crosses Pushpa 2, nears Rs 1300 crore Dhurandhar, directed by Aditya Dhar and starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna, has officially become the highest-earning Hindi film of all time, surpassing previous benchmarks with a total India net collection of Rs 831.40 crore and a worldwide gross of Rs 1,227 crore at the end of day 34

Disney's Tangled finds its magic duo in Teagan Croft and Milo Manheim Disney has confirmed that Teagan Croft and Milo Manheim will play Rapunzel and Flynn Rider respectively in the upcoming live-action reimagining of Tangled, following a lengthy casting process and anticipation from fans.

No censor clearance for Parasakthi yet: Will it face Jana Nayagan delay drama? Sivakarthikeyan's Parasakthi awaits censor board clearance ahead of its January 10 release. The delay raises concerns of a repeat of Jana Nayagan's censor troubles and impacts theatre bookings.

Director Rakeysh Mehra shares Delhi-6 ending that never made it to Indian theatres Filmmaker Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra discussed the unreleased version of his 2009 film 'Delhi-6', and reflected on why he changed the ending for its Indian release.

general news.headline: Mamata Banerjee's poll strategist raided by ED, she cries document 'chori'Mamata Banerjee's poll strategist raided by ED, she cries document 'chori'

Mumbai Mayor's seat reserved for Marathi Hindu, 100%: Devendra FadnavisChief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, speaking at Aaj Tak's Mumbai Manthan, underlined that the BJP followed a 'nation first' ideology and rejected claims that the party seeks to divide voters along Marathi and non-Marathi lines.

Vedanta's Anil Agarwal will give away 75% wealth to fulfil dead son's wishWith his son's death, Anil Agarwal says his commitment to give away over 75% of earnings stands firm, signalling a deeper shift toward philanthropy, simpler living, and long-term social investment beyond business success.

Fighter jets to help Pak stop taking IMF loans: Khwaja Asif's pants are on firePakistan's Defence Minister, Khwaja Asif, has claimed that Islamabad was getting record orders for fighter jets and might not need IMF's financial assistance after six months. This, he said, came after the four-day mini-war with India. Saudi Arabia, for one, is considering a jets-for-loan deal. Here's a look at Pakistan's public debt and liabilities vis-a-vis Asif's claim.

Jana Nayagan postponed: Nearly Rs 50 crore loss, refunds initiated for Vijay filmVijay's Jana Nayagan was postponed two days before release due to a censor certificate delay. This last-minute change has led to significant financial losses and disrupted international screen allocations.

Live: Dog can smell human who is afraid and bite them, Supreme Court observesSupreme Court Hearing Live Updates: The Supreme Court on Thursday resumed the hearings on the stray dog issue, with a bench comprising Justices Vikram Nath, Sandeep Mehta, and NV Anjaria. The proceedings focus on petitions highlighting the risks posed by stray animals and the alleged lapses of civic authorities in controlling them. On Wednesday, the bench sharply flagged non-compliance by municipal bodies, noting that fatalities in India were not solely due to dog bites but, also accidents caused by stray animals on roads.  Observing that no one can predict an animal's "mood to bite or not", the bench stressed the principle that "prevention is better than cure". In November last year, the Supreme Court had ordered the removal of stray dogs from sensitive public spaces, including schools, hospitals, bus stands, sports complexes, and railway stations and directed that these animals be transferred to designated shelters. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Eknath Shinde raised BJP-Congress Ambernath tie-up shocker with Devendra FadnavisShinde's remarks at Aaj Tak's Mumbai Manthan 2026 event came a day after longtime rivals BJP and Congress joined hands with the NCP to form the Ambernath Vikas Aghadi (AVA), sidelining the Shinde-led Shiv Sena faction despite it being the largest party in the December 20 municipal polls in Ambernath, located in Thane district.

More trouble for India? Trump-backed bill threatens 500% tariffs over Russian oilRepublican Senator Lindsey Graham said President Donald Trump cleared the new sanctions bill after they held a "productive" meeting on Wednesday, adding that it could be put to vote as early as next week.
Not Goa, not Jaipur but this Indian destination is winning over global travellersOne city in this state has emerged as the fastest-growing destination for international travellers to India.

Live: Uddhav Thackeray is unpredictable, Raj Thackeray a confused man, says FadnavisMumbai Manthan Live Updates: Top politicians, including Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, his deputy Eknath Shinde and Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut are participating in Aaj Tak's Mumbai Manthan 2026 event ahead of the January 15 elections to 29 municipal corporations across the state, including Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). The event also sees top actors, experts and businessmen gracing the event and sharing their views about Mumbai and Maharashtra and their future. Stay tuned with India Today TV for further updates.

What Poland said about India as US turns up heat over Russian oilWe are satisfied, said Poland Foreign Minister Radosaw Sikorski as he backed India as New Delhi faces sharp tariff threats from the US over its continued imports of Russian crude oil.

Caught on camera: Iranian cop chased, shot dead in drive-by attack amid protestsA police officer was killed in a drive-by shooting in Iran as the country faces nationwide protests over economic distress. The incident was caught on camera, and it shows the cop being attacked until his car veered off the road and crashed.

Bengaluru founder who once earned Rs 40,000 as Zomato rider defends Deepinder GoyalIn a post on LinkedIn, Suraj Biswas, founder of Assessli, said his support came from first-hand experience, having worked as a Zomato delivery partner in Bengaluru during 2020–21, before launching his company.

US exits dozens of international agencies, including India-led Solar AllianceThe White House said on Wednesday that Trump signed a proclamation pulling the US out of 35 non-United Nations bodies and 31 United Nations-linked entities following a sweeping review of America's global commitments.

Cold blast starts now: Delhi records season's lowest temperatureThe minimum temperature in Delhi plummeted to 5.8 degrees Celsius amid severe cold conditions in the national capital. The IMD has warned that cold conditions are likely to persist through the week.

US, Russia tensions rise after oil tanker seizure: A blow-by-blow accountA high-seas seizure of a Russian-flagged oil tanker by US forces has brought Washington and Moscow to the brink of a new diplomatic clash. Russia has called the move illegal, while the US says it was enforcing sanctions linked to Venezuela.

Toxic teaser: Yash as Raya unleashes a fierce world of violence and destructionThe teaser for Yash's 'Toxic – A Fairytale for Grown-Ups' is out, sparking huge excitement among fans. Promising an edgy, stylish world supported by a strong ensemble and international crew, the film is slated for a big March 19 release.

Phone stolen in Varanasi, Mumbai techie tracks it herself after cop inactionWith help from friends, the woman tracked her stolen phone to a house in Varanasi, informed police, and enabled the recovery of her handset along with 12 other stolen mobile phones.

Coach lures teen Haryana shooter to hotel for performance review, rapes herA national shooting coach allegedly raped a 17-year-old shooter inside a hotel room in Faridabad after calling her under the pretext of evaluating her performance. Police said the accused forced her into the hotel room where the incident occurred.
Medical emergency on Space Station, Nasa could return astronautAstronauts Mike Fincke and Zena Cardman were set to conduct US spacewalk 94, lasting about 6.5 hours, starting around 8:00 a.m. EST.

Bengaluru man works as Rapido bike captain for 4 days, shares earnings breakdownThe man shared a transparent breakdown of hours worked, earnings and expenses after riding part-time with Rapido, primarily during late-night hours.

Bangladesh unfairly treated? What to make of ICC's firm T20 World Cup standThe Bangladesh Cricket Board is hurt by the abrupt termination of Mustafizur Rahman's IPL contract. But is seeking relocation of T20 World Cup matches from India fair? The ICC has insisted Bangladesh stick to the original schedule.

YouTuber arrested, cop on the run after gangraping schoolgirl in KanpurThe family of the 14-year-old girl has accused local police of attempting a cover-up, claiming they were initially dismissed when they indicated a Sub-Inspector's involvement.

Revisiting Bimal Roy's Parakh: A political satire rooted in human frailtyJanuary 8, 2026, marks Bimal Roy's 60th death anniversary. We revisit his craft, discussing one of his most unusual films – the 1960 satire, Parakh. Through the film, Roy restored faith in humanism and used  the power of satire to reveal frailty without judgment.

sports.headline: Australia's Steve Smith unsure if he will play in 2027 Ashes in England Steve Smith has cast doubt on his availability for the 2027 Ashes in England after Australia's ageing but resilient squad sealed a dominant 4-1 series victory in the home campaign.

ISL restarts, but players bear the cost: How pay cut demands spell a fresh crisis The ISL will restart on February 14, but players are being asked to take salary cuts of up to 25 percent. With no commercial partner in place, footballers are paying the price for survival.

Damien Martyn out of hospital amid meningitis battle, Waugh calls it miracle Former Australian batter Damien Martyn has been discharged from hospital after recovering from a serious bout of meningitis. Fellow cricketers Adam Gilchrist and Mark Waugh described his recovery as remarkable, expressing relief and gratitude for the support received during his illness.

Tottenham boss Thomas Frank trolled after spotted drinking from Arsenal cup Tottenham boss Thomas Frank was trolled after being spotted with an Arsenal cup before Spurs' Bournemouth clash. The Dane later insisted he never noticed the logo, calling the controversy unnecessary and misplaced.

WPL 2026 set for new highs as Indian women's cricket finds its peak WPL 2026: The fourth edition of the Women's Premier League will be held from January 9 to February 5 across Navi Mumbai and Baroda. Mumbai Indians are the competition's two-time champions, while Royal Challengers Bengaluru lifted the title in 2024.

Ben Stokes avoids England captaincy talks after Ashes loss: Time to right our wrongs Ben Stokes avoided captaincy questions after England's 4–1 Ashes loss in Australia. Speaking after the Sydney Test defeat, the England skipper focused on reflection and future plans, offering no hint of a leadership change.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi is too good for U-19 cricket: Is it too early for India debut? Vaibhav Suryavanshi's numbers in the youth level point to inevitability, but 2026 may test more than talent. As pressure, IPL responsibility and expectations grow, how he responds could define his future.

20-year-old Ayush Shetty proves big-league mettle against world champion Malaysia Open 2026: It ended in defeat against World No. 1 Shi Yuqi, but Ayush Shetty walked away with something far more valuable — proof that his game stands up to the very best.

What's all this brother? Ashwin amazed by Vaibhav Suryavanshi's run-scoring spree Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin summed up the awe around Vaibhav Suryavanshi's staggering run spree. At just 14, the teenage opener is redefining age-group dominance ahead of the Under-19 World Cup and IPL 2026.

Australia win Ashes in style, hand England 4-1 defeat, Bazball reality check Ashes: Australia secured a 4-1 series victory in the Ashes 2025-26 with a five-wicket win in the final Test in Sydney. The Steve Smith-led side chased down the target of 160 in the second session to complete a dominant series.

Versatile Beau Webster steps up in Tests as pressure grows on Cameron Green Ashes: Beau Webster's batting and off-spin on Day 4 of the final Test against England have boosted his selection prospects and intensified the pressure on Cameron Green as Australia's Test all-rounder.

Tilak Varma undergoes surgery for testicular torsion, out of New Zealand T20IsIndia have suffered a major blow ahead of T20 World Cup as Tilak Varma has sustained a testicular injury. He's unlikely to feature in the T20I series against New Zealand.

Shubman Gill meets KSI: India captain and British YouTuber link up in MumbaiIndia ODI and Test captain Shubman Gill met global YouTube star KSI in Mumbai during the latter's India visit. The casual crossover caught fans' attention ahead of Gill's return to international cricket.

Harmanpreet's captaincy record untouchable, has 4-5 more years in her: JhulanJhulan Goswami praised Harmanpreet Kaur's record as India captain and her WPL success with Mumbai Indians. She believes Harmanpreet has four to five years of cricket left and an unmatched legacy ahead of her.

Malaysia Open live: Sindhu storms into quarters, Lakshya and Ayush bow outMalaysia Open live score: PV Sindhu stormed into the quarterfinals of the Super 1000 tournament for the fourth time in her career. She outclassed eighth seed Tomoko Miyazaki of Japan in just 32 minutes. Earlier in the day, Ayush Shetty lost a valiant battle to World No. 1 Shi Yuqi in the men's singles second round. Lakshya Sen too bowed out.

Bangladesh unfairly treated? What to make of ICC's firm T20 World Cup standThe Bangladesh Cricket Board is hurt by the abrupt termination of Mustafizur Rahman's IPL contract. But is seeking relocation of T20 World Cup matches from India fair? The ICC has insisted Bangladesh stick to the original schedule.

Manager-less Manchester United continue dull ways with Burnley drawManchester United's post-Amorim reset stalled at Turf Moor as familiar flaws resurfaced. Benjamin Sesko shone with a brace, yet defensive lapses and late concession ensured another draw, deepening uncertainty before crucial FA Cup decisions looming.

Start from zero: Shadab Khan relishes dream comeback with T20 World Cup in sightSL vs PAK, 1st T20I: Shadab Khan marked his T20I comeback with a Player of the Match performance against Sri Lanka, stressing that international returns mean starting from zero and focusing on one step at a time.

Shaheen Afridi likely to recover within a week, T20 World Cup 2026 plans on trackShaheen Afridi, Pakistan cricket team, knee injury update, Shaheen Afridi rehab, PCB medical team, T20 cricket Pakistan, Pakistan fast bowlers, Shaheen Afridi fitness, Lahore Qalandars, Pakistan cricket news

'India Is A Very Safe Place': Telangana Minister On Bangladesh Security ConcernsA Telangana minister and former Indian cricket captain addresses the recent concerns raised by the Bangladesh Cricket Association regarding security for the T20 World Cup in India. Dismissing these apprehensions, the speaker asserts, 'I think India is a very safe place,' and emphasizes that the tournament will proceed in the country with 'no second way.' The interviewee suggests that any decision made by the BCCI would have been discussed with the government, prioritizing the larger interest of security. Referring to the situation as Bangladesh's 'lookout,' the former captain expresses confidence in India's security system. The discussion also briefly touches upon a recent controversy involving a Bangladeshi cricketer. The minister concludes by affirming that the event will go ahead as planned, regardless of the concerns raised.

Tata Steel Chess: Viswanathan Anand rolls back the years to share Rapid lead on Day 1Former world champion Viswanathan Anand marked his return with two key wins to end day one tied at the top with Hans Niemann, as Carissa Yip led the women's section with 2.5 points after three rounds.

Lionel Messi dismisses coaching interest, prefers club ownership after retirementLionel Messi expresses a clear preference for club ownership over coaching after his playing career, following a season of record-breaking achievements. The football legend outlines his vision for youth development and continued involvement in football off the pitch.

How Jasprit Bumrah inspired Shreyanka Patil to bounce back after injuryIndian all-rounder Shreyanka Patil credits Jasprit Bumrah's guidance during her injury-hit layoff for helping her regain confidence as she prepares for a WPL 2026 comeback with RCB against Mumbai Indians.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi's heroics with bat and ball leads India-U19 to 3-0 whitewashVaibhav Suryavanshi led from the front with a century and a wicket as India U-19 crushed South Africa by 233 runs to seal a dominant 3-0 whitewash in the Youth ODI series.

Bangladesh firm on T20 World Cup stance: No cricket at cost of national dignityBangladesh have remained firm on their decision not to play T20 World Cup matches in India, citing security and national humiliation concerns following Mustafizur Rahman's exit from Kolkata Knight Riders, which has escalated tensions with India.

Don't like India-Pakistan cricket beef: Ex-West Indies captain calls for unityJason Holder says the India–Pakistan divide is sad and should not overshadow cricket. The West Indies all-rounder believes sport can play a role in easing political tensions.

England must now move on from failed Bazball project after Ashes: VaughanEngland must finally move away from their high-risk 'Bazball' approach and return to Test cricket basics after their Ashes defeat, former captain Michael Vaughan said in an interview with Reuters on Wednesday.

Shreyas Iyer declared fit by BCCI, cleared for New Zealand ODI seriesShreyas Iyer has been declared fit for international cricket after receiving clearance from the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) Centre of Excellence (CoE), removing the final medical hurdle ahead of India's ODI series against New Zealand.

New Zealand worried about ODI series vs India, not T20 World Cup: Daryl MitchellNew Zealand are not dwelling on the T20 World Cup, which is still a month away, and are instead focused on the immediate challenge of taking on India's bowlers in the upcoming white-ball series, batter Daryl Mitchell said on Wednesday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
